sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The round function is used to convert a real number to an integer. The result is the nearest integer to r. In the case of a tie, the numerically larger value is returned. For example, round (3) is 3, round (2.85) is 3 and round (-8.43) is -8.
sections.text_content: The round function is used to convert a real number to an integer. The result is the nearest integer to r. In the case of a tie, the numerically larger value is returned. For example, round (3) is 3, round (2.85) is 3 and round (-8.43) is -8.
sections.mdown_content: The **round** function is used to convert a **real** number to an integer. The result is the nearest integer to _r_. In the case of a tie, the numerically larger value is returned. For example, **round** (3) is 3, **round** (2.85) is 3 and **round** (-8.43) is -8.
